title: Contributing to ssdsims
text: outlines propose change ssdsims.

title: Contributing to ssdsims
text: can fix typos, spelling mistakes, grammatical errors documentation directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. generally means ’ll need edit roxygen2 comments .R, .Rd file. can find .R file generates .Rd reading comment first line.

title: Contributing to ssdsims
text: want make bigger change, ’s good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s needed. ’ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed).

title: Contributing to ssdsims
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("", fork = TRUE). Install development dependences devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. Begin commit merge messages - indicate user facing changes included NEWS.md. use fledge automatically generate NEWS.md file.

title: Contributing to ssdsims
text: New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use styler package apply styles, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: Contributing to ssdsims
text: Please note ssdsims project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project agree abide terms.

title: Getting help with ssdsims
text: Thanks using ssdsims! filing issue, places explore pieces put together make process smooth possible.

title: Getting help with ssdsims
text: opening new issue, sure search issues pull requests make sure bug hasn’t reported /already fixed development version. default, search pre-populated :issue :open. can edit qualifiers (e.g. :pr, :closed) needed. example, ’d simply remove :open search issues repo, open closed.

title: Getting help with ssdsims
text: Start making minimal reproducible example using reprex package. haven’t heard used reprex , ’re treat! Seriously, reprex make R-question-asking endeavors easier (pretty insane ROI five ten minutes ’ll take learn ’s ). additional reprex pointers, check Get help! section tidyverse site.

title: Generate Data for Simulations — ssd_generate_data
text: family functions generate tibble nested data sets.

title: Generate Data for Simulations — ssd_generate_data
code: ssd_generate_data(x, ...)  # S3 method for class 'data.frame' ssd_generate_data(x, ..., replace = FALSE, nrow = 6L, nsim = 100L)  # S3 method for class 'fitdists' ssd_generate_data(x, ..., dist = "top", nrow = 6L, nsim = 100L)  # S3 method for class 'tmbfit' ssd_generate_data(x, ..., nrow = 6L, nsim = 100L)  # S3 method for class 'character' ssd_generate_data(x, ..., pars = list(), nrow = 6L, nsim = 100L)  # S3 method for class '`function`' ssd_generate_data(x, ..., args = list(), nrow = 6L, nsim = 100L)

title: Generate Data for Simulations — ssd_generate_data
text: x object use generating data. ... Unused. replace flag specifying whether sample replacement. nrow integer vector number rows generated data. nsim count number data sets generate. dist string specifying distribution fitdists object "top" use distribution weight "multi" treat distributions single distribution. pars named list parameter values. args named list argument values.

title: Generate Data for Simulations — ssd_generate_data
text: tibble nested data sets.

title: Generate Data for Simulations — ssd_generate_data
text: ssd_generate_data(data.frame): Generate data data.frame ssd_generate_data(fitdists): Generate data fitdists object ssd_generate_data(tmbfit): Generate data tmbfit object ssd_generate_data(character): Generate data using distribution name ssd_generate_data(`function`): Generate data using function

title: Generate Data for Simulations — ssd_generate_data
code: ssd_generate_data(ssddata::ccme_boron, nrow = 5, nsim = 3) #> # A tibble: 3 × 2 #>     sim data             #>   <int> <list>           #> 1     1 <tibble [5 × 1]> #> 2     2 <tibble [5 × 1]> #> 3     3 <tibble [5 × 1]>  fit <- ssdtools::ssd_fit_dists(ssddata::ccme_boron) ssd_generate_data(fit, nrow = 5, nsim = 3) #> # A tibble: 3 × 2 #>     sim data             #>   <int> <list>           #> 1     1 <tibble [5 × 1]> #> 2     2 <tibble [5 × 1]> #> 3     3 <tibble [5 × 1]>  fit <- ssdtools::ssd_fit_dists(ssddata::ccme_boron) ssd_generate_data(fit[[1]], nrow = 5, nsim = 3) #> # A tibble: 3 × 2 #>     sim data             #>   <int> <list>           #> 1     1 <tibble [5 × 1]> #> 2     2 <tibble [5 × 1]> #> 3     3 <tibble [5 × 1]>  ssd_generate_data("lnorm", nrow = 5, nsim = 3) #> # A tibble: 3 × 2 #>     sim data             #>   <int> <list>           #> 1     1 <tibble [5 × 1]> #> 2     2 <tibble [5 × 1]> #> 3     3 <tibble [5 × 1]>  ssd_generate_data(ssdtools::ssd_rlnorm, nrow = 5, nsim = 3) #> # A tibble: 3 × 2 #>     sim data             #>   <int> <list>           #> 1     1 <tibble [5 × 1]> #> 2     2 <tibble [5 × 1]> #> 3     3 <tibble [5 × 1]>
